# E60HL-230051_C RFSO Marine Fuel NMSO 2023-2025

## Key Project Information

* **Contract Reference Number**: WS3915620080-Doc4035452699
* **Amendment Number**: 4
* **Publication Date**: June 1, 2023
* **Tender Closing Date**: June 12, 2023 (14:00:00)
* **Expected Contract Start Date**: June 1, 2023
* **Expected Contract End Date**: May 31, 2025

## Invitation to Bidders

The [Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC)](#department-of-public-works-and-government-services-pspc) invites interested suppliers to submit a request for a standing offer for the supply of marine fuels. The standing offer will be used by various government departments, including the [Department of Fisheries and Oceans (DFO)], [Parks Canada Agency (PC)], and [Department of National Defence (DND)], for delivery to various locations across Canada.

## Amendments and Notice

Please disregard the original closing time posted on Ariba Discovery and Buyandsell. All required supporting documentation and bid submissions must be submitted on June 12, 2023, at 2:00 PM EDT. Bids submitted after 2:00 PM EDT will be declared non-responsive.

## Specification and Requirements

This request cancels and supersedes a previous request for standing offer (WS3915620080, Doc3993116459 - E60HL-230051_B) dated May 4, 2023, with a closing date of May 15, 2023. A debriefing or feedback session will be provided to offerors/suppliers who bid on the previous request.

The standing offer will be for the supply of marine fuels in accordance with Canadian General Standards Board (CGSB) standards, as specified in Appendix A. Delivery will be required to various locations across Canada, including Comprehensive Land Claims Settlement Areas.

## Trade Agreements and Regions of Opportunity

This standing offer is open to suppliers from countries participating in various free trade agreements, including the Canada-Chile Free Trade Agreement (CCFTA), Canada-Ukraine Free Trade Agreement (CUFTA), and the Canada-European Union Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement (CETA). Suppliers are encouraged to bid from across Canada.

## Contact Information

For more information and to submit a bid, please contact Bobbi MacLeod, SPAC/PSPC,
